name: Blastoise

abilities.name: Rain Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 1 Water Energy card to 1 of your Water Pokémon. (This doesn't use up your 1 Energy card attachment for the turn.) This power can't be used if Blastoise is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

flavorText: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high-speed tackles.

strengths: Rain Dance is one of the best Pokemon Powers ever printed
Enables explosive turns with multiple energy attachments
100 HP is solid for the era
Hydro Pump can hit for 60 with enough energy
weaknesses: Lightning weakness to Electabuzz is problematic
Vulnerable when status conditions block Rain Dance
synergies: Articuno - Powerful attacker to receive Rain Dance energy
Professor Oak - Draw into Water Energy
counters: Electabuzz - Lightning weakness and fast setup
Energy Removal - Discard Rain Dance energy
Gust of Wind - Force Blastoise active before ready

competitiveHistory: Blastoise Rain Dance was one of the most dominant archetypes in early Pokemon TCG. The ability to attach unlimited Water Energy per turn enabled explosive plays and rapid board development. Combined with powerful Water attackers, Rain Dance defined the metagame and forced every deck to have an answer to it.

rulings.ruling: Rain Dance can only attach Water Energy cards, not Special Energy that provides Water.
You can use Rain Dance to attach Water Energy to any of your Water Pokemon, including Benched Pokemon.
Rain Dance doesn't use up your normal Energy attachment for the turn.
Hydro Pump's bonus damage is calculated based on Water Energy attached beyond the 3 needed to pay for the attack.
The +20 damage cap on Hydro Pump means maximum damage is 60, even with more than 5 Water Energy attached.
